text: When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Rosa, who was turning 92 this year was eager to get the anti-aging drug and she was ready wait in line in her local hospital. When it was her turn, the nurse attending to her initially declined to give her the drug, but Rosa convinced her by saying, "I'm old, I'm tired, I'm ready to die. Just give me the drug, kid." 

Hesitantly the nurse gave her the drug. She listed several side effects, including fever, nausea, and other common side effects. Last on the list of side effects, the nurse said, "there's a very little chance of people over the age of 85 to become a giant...

Hesitantly the nurse gave her the drug. She listed several side effects, including fever, nausea, and other common side effects. Last on the list of side effects, the nurse said, "there's a very little chance of people over the age of 85 to become a giant...  like a giant rat."

Rosa was not listening as she took the drug and drank water from her water bottle to push it through her body. Rosa was not listening as she took the drug and drank water from her water bottle to push it through her body. Last on the list of side effects, the nurse said, "there's a very little chance of people over the age of 85 to become a giant... like a giant rat."

Right as the nurse said the word rat, Rosa puffed like a giant balloon with fur and long nose, and with a tail. She is now a giant rat. Rosa exclaimed, "I'm a giant rat!" walking away from the nurse very fast, and very nimble. She then went to the streets to eat garbage.

"I told you it was a bad idea to give the drug to old people!" said another.

Because of the growing population of rat-persons the United States have designated a special area for them to live in. It's in the middle of the desert, and it's called Rat City.

Because of the growing population of rat-persons the United States have designated a special area for them to live in. It's in the middle of the desert, and it's called Rat City. All the individuals who turned into a giant rat went in there. Visitations were limited at daylight when the rat-persons were less aggressive. Before it was prohibited to visit during the night, one incident were a man was attacked and eaten by a giant rat.

Hesitantly the nurse gave her the drug. She listed several side effects, including fever, nausea, and other common side effects.  Rosa was not listening as she took the drug and drank water from her water bottle to push it through her body. Last on the list of side effects, the nurse said, "there's a very little chance of people over the age of 85 to become a giant... like a giant rat."

Right as the nurse said the word rat, Rosa puffed like a giant balloon with fur and long nose, and with a tail. She is now a giant rat. Rosa exclaimed, "I'm a giant rat!" walking away from the nurse very fast, and very nimble. She then went to the streets to eat garbage. Onlookers were terrified. "Not again!" said one person. "I told you it was a bad idea to give the drug to old people!" said another.

Because of the growing population of rat-persons the United States have designated a special area for them to live in. It's in the middle of the desert, and it's called Rat City. All the individuals who turned into a giant rat went in there. Visitations were limited at daylight when the rat-persons were less aggressive. Before it was prohibited to visit during the night, one incident were a man was attacked and eaten by a giant rat.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

Rosa, who was turning 92 this year was eager to get the anti-aging drug and she was ready wait in line in her local hospital. When it was her turn, the nurse attending to her initially declined to give her the drug, but Rosa convinced her by saying, "I'm old, I'm tired, I'm ready to die. Just give me the drug, kid." 

Hesitantly the nurse gave her the drug. She listed several side effects, including fever, nausea, and other common side effects.  Rosa was not listening as she took the drug and drank water from her water bottle to push it through her body. Last on the list of side effects, the nurse said, "there's a very little chance of people over the age of 85 to become a giant... like a giant rat."

Right as the nurse said the word rat, Rosa puffed like a giant balloon with fur and long nose, and with a tail. She is now a giant rat. Rosa exclaimed, "I'm a giant rat!" walking away from the nurse very fast, and very nimble. She then went to the streets to eat garbage. Onlookers were terrified. "Not again!" said one person. "I told you it was a bad idea to give the drug to old people!" said another.

Because of the growing population of rat-persons the United States have designated a special area for them to live in. It's in the middle of the desert, and it's called Rat City. All the individuals who turned into a giant rat went in there. Visitations were limited at daylight when the rat-persons were less aggressive. Before it was prohibited to visit during the night, one incident were a man was attacked and eaten by a giant rat.

Rosa moved to the Rat City the next day. She did not pack anything but she was visibly excited with her new life. She told her grandkids right after she was saying goodbye, "I'm going to live forever now, I'm a giant rat!"
